message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
int counter = 0;
List<Comparable> temp = new ArrayList<>();
for(Comparable item : A) {
    temp.add(item);
    counter++;
    if(counter == n) {
        // do stuff with temp
        temp.clear();
        counter = 0;
    }
}
if(!temp.isEmpty()) {
    // do stuff with remaining items in temp
}
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of creating new sublists and using the subArray method, you can add items to a temporary list until it reaches the desired size (n). Once it does, you can perform your operation on the temp list, clear it, and continue with the next set of items. This way, you're only ever working with a maximum of n items at a time, which should be more efficient.
